OLE.utils package#

Submodules#

OLE.utils.base module#

Here we are going to define a base class. It will be the parent class of all other classes.

It has a timer function that will be used by all other classes.

It has a logger function that will be used by all other classes.

The buildup is inspired by Cobaya (CobayaSampler) by Jesus Torrado and Antony Lewis.

class OLE.utils.base.BaseClass(name=None, debug=False, **kwargs)#

Bases: Logger, Timer

debug_mode: bool#

OLE.utils.mpi module#

MPI implementation for OLE. This module is a wrapper around mpi4py. It works if mpi4py is installed, but it is not required.

The implementation is based upon the COBAYA MPI implementation.

Credits to Jesus Torrado.

OLE.utils.mpi.get_mpi()#

Import and returns the MPI object, or None if not running with MPI.

Can be used as a boolean test if MPI is present.

OLE.utils.mpi.get_mpi_comm()#

Returns the MPI communicator, or None if not running with MPI.

OLE.utils.mpi.get_mpi_rank()#
Returns the rank of the current MPI process:

  • None: not running with MPI

  • Z>=0: process rank, when running with MPI

Can be used as a boolean that returns False for both the root process, if running with MPI, or always for a single process; thus, everything under if not(get_mpi_rank()): is run only once.

OLE.utils.mpi.get_mpi_size()#

Returns the number of MPI processes that have been invoked, or 0 if not running with MPI.

OLE.utils.mpi.is_main_process()#

Returns true if primary process or MPI not available.
